story_summary: Alyosha, a young man of twenty, is described as pure-hearted and deeply attached to the elder Zossima, which influenced his decision to enter monastic life. After the death of his benefactor Yefim Petrovitch, Alyosha leaves school early and returns home to seek out his mother's grave, which his father Fyodor Pavlovitch had neglected. Alyosha announces his intention to become a monk, and despite Fyodor Pavlovitch's drunken cynicism, he agrees to support his son's decision.
evidence_quotes: Not long after visiting his mother’s grave Alyosha suddenly announced that he wanted to enter the monastery
His father... said, 'So you want to be a monk?... I’m sorry to lose you, Alyosha'
